intro: Habenaria paranaguensis f. minor, commonly known as the minor form of the Paranaguá orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Brazil. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. It has a sympodial growth habit with rhizomes and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
